queries.description: Casting from a virtual base class to a derived class using anything other than dynamic_cast causes undefined behavior.
queries.name: A virtual base class shall only be cast to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast

RULE-8-2-1.title: A virtual base class shall only be cast to a derived class by means of dynamic_cast

queries.description: Using C-style casts or functional notation casts allows unsafe type conversions and makes code harder to maintain compared to using named casts like const_cast, dynamic_cast, static_cast and reinterpret_cast.
queries.name: C-style casts and functional notation casts shall not be used

RULE-8-2-2.title: C-style casts and functional notation casts shall not be used

queries.description: Casting from an integral type, enumerated type, or pointer to void type to a pointer type leads to unspecified behavior and is error prone.
queries.name: An object with integral, enumerated, or pointer to void type shall not be cast to a pointer type

RULE-8-2-6.title: An object with integral, enumerated, or pointer to void type shall not be cast to a pointer type

queries.description: Casting between pointer types and integral types makes code behavior harder to understand and may cause pointer tracking tools to become unreliable.
queries.name: A cast should not convert a pointer type to an integral type

RULE-8-2-7.title: A cast should not convert a pointer type to an integral type

queries.description: Casting object pointers to integral types other than std::uintptr_t or std::intptr_t can lead to implementation-defined behavior and potential loss of pointer information.
queries.name: An object pointer type shall not be cast to an integral type other than std::uintptr_t or

RULE-8-2-8.title: An object pointer type shall not be cast to an integral type other than std::uintptr_t or std::intptr_t

queries.description: Using an explicit type conversion as an expression statement creates a temporary object that is immediately discarded, which can lead to unintended premature resource cleanup.
queries.name: An explicit type conversion shall not be an expression statement

implementation_scope.description: Expression statements in if statement initializers are not currently supported.

RULE-9-2-1.title: An explicit type conversion shall not be an expression statement
